title: (x) 'Stock ticker' type - various {gang}
content:
Have searched the archives and looked through a load of bitmap fonts but haven't really found what I'm looking for ...   
   
I need something that approximates a hi-res dot-matrix display, something like in this image of the MorganStanley stock ticker from Times Square.   
   
Doesn't need to have the 'pixels' separate if you know what I mean -- just a nice, fairly functional-looking bitmap.   
   
R   
   
 ![StockTicker](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224316im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/39130.jpg)
author: rjohnston

comments.content:
FontFont and Emigrï¿½ both have some fonts that would approximate this look, but they are not 'bitmapped' fonts, per se. FF Gateway, Aircraft or Luggagetag might all do, if a font is in order.   
   
Look at DaFont.com if you really want bitmapped fonts, or do a search with Google on that term.

Thanks Mike,   
   
Gateway and Luggagetag are both nice, but just not quite there. DaFont also didn't have anything I hadn't already seen. It's for a logotype, so I'm making my own letters, but I was looking for some inspiration as I haven't made this type of letter before (the R and N are a pig to get looking right ...). I think I'm getting it working now though.   
   
R

Something from [Test Pilot Collective](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224316/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=tpc&itemsperpage=57&resultcount=57&page=1) or [Lineto](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224316/http:/www.lineto.com/) might yield something for you.

Robert -- there are ways to emulate the stock   
ticker look using some photoshop and   
an existing font ...   
you get something like this ... it could   
be tweaked more ...   
   
 ![type4.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224316im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/39157.jpg)   
   
feel free to contact me if you'd like the skinny.   
   
bj

\<font class="dontLookLikeCrap"\>Have you flipped trough dafont?   
   
in category   
http://www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=302&page=1   
   
I could find several that could match your descriptions, like:   
Big Dots   
DS-point   
High Speed   
MK Zodnig square   
Nokian   
   
\</font\>

Chesh: Looked at those already, but ta anyways.   
   
bj: I'm OK with the emulation bit (working on a grid in Illustrator and then scaling each grid square is my way at the moment).   
   
Jan: I obviously wasn't looking hard enough at DaFont. Some of those look useful. I think I'm still going to go with custom letters but these are at least a bit out of the mainstream. [BigDots](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224316/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=302&page=1) and [DS Point](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224316/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=302&page=3) are definitely in the right area.   
   
Thanks guys, very helpful as usual.   
   
R
